owl:Ontology.rdfs:comment: Common Concepts (CC) defines the data model for common concepts used in the Capability Model and Resource Model, in order to increase the re-use of the concepts. Currently used for testing.
owl:Ontology.dc:title: Common Concepts Ontology
owl:Ontology.dc:creator: Eeva Järvenpää
owl:Ontology.rdfs:comment:
The ontology has been defined at Tampere University of Technology, Finland, by Eeva Järvenpää, Niko Siltala and Otto Hylli. The research has received funding from the European Union Horizon 2020 Programm under grant agreement nbr 680759 (Project ReCaM - Rapid Reconfiguration of Flexible Production Systems through Capability-based Adaptation, Auto-configuration and Integrated tools for Production Planning)
Licencing: Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License (CC BY-SA 4.0) To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/
owl:Ontology.dc:description: Common Concepts (CC) defines the data model for common concepts used in the Capability Model and Resource Model, in order to increase the re-use of the concepts.
owl:Ontology.rdfs:label: Common Concepts Ontology

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This class consists of an enumerated list of different material types. Can be used to link the capabilities with their suitable materials, or products to the material from which they are made of.
